reviews.text: Nobody at the kiosk and machine refused to give me a ticket to farrington so had to pay extra for a travel card. Complete rip off

It's a station! There's a ticket office, which is usually staffed. If there are no staff then there are automatic ticket machines on the platform. In the mornings during the week, there is a small coffee shop on the London bound platform. There is ample parking available with a car wash service on hand. The station has good bus connections to Southend, Basildon and Stansted airport. There is also a taxi service that has an office on site. As functional stations goes, it works well! The train service, well that's a whole different story

does what a trains meant to gets u from a to b. dont understand people on here sayin poor service ur basically serving yourself when u get a train what service do u expect? its lot better sevice than train station in say london or any busy stayions u have less waiting time if purchasing from the ticket office, its less crowded, cleaner and faster service
